fullDescription.intro:
This node implements the Phenomizer algorithm for the PhenoDis database at Helmholtz Zentrum.
The Phenomizer algorithm is an ontology-based similarity search algorithm. It compares a list of symptoms against a set of annotated diseases. The similarity measure of the algorithm makes use of a symptom ontology i.e a directed acyclic graph that represents a is-a hierarchy of the symptoms. The algorithm is described in detail in ... .
Phenomizer requires several input tables. Table 0 to 2 are directly extracted from PhenoDis. Table 3 contains the PhenoDis symptom_ids of the query symptoms. Note that the column names of the tables have to match the names specified in the ports section. For more information about the format of the input tables see example data from ... .
fullDescription.option: Limits the number of diseases passed to the outport table

ports.inPort: Symptom table from PhenoDis with columns symptom_id and symptom_name
ISA table from PhenoDis with columns parent_id and child_id
KSZ table from PhenoDis with columns disease_id, disease, symptom_id
ports.outPort: Diseases with high similarity to the query symptoms
